clinical_study.brief_title: Influence of Oxygen on Non-invasive Measurement of Hemoglobin
clinical_study.official_title: Influence of the Inspired Oxygen Fraction on the Noninvasive Measurement of Hemoglobin Using Two Different Devices (Namely Pronto 7 and NBM-200)

brief_summary.textblock: This study examines the effect of oxygen supplementation on the non-invasive measurement of hemoglobin.

primary_outcome.measure: influence of the inspired oxygen fraction on the noninvasive measurement of hemoglobin (Pronto 7 and NBM-200 devices)
primary_outcome.time_frame: one year (end of the recrutement period)
primary_outcome.description: Statistical comparison of the 3 measurements (baseline, FiO2 50%, FiO295%) for each device

secondary_outcome.measure: agreement between the noninvasive methods of measurement of hemoglobin and the laboratory analysis
secondary_outcome.time_frame: one year (end of the recrutement period)

arm_group.description: patients studied just before induction of anesthesia

intervention.description: Non invasive hemoglobin measurements (Pronto 7 device and NBM-200 device)will be made with : at baseline (simultaneous blood sample for a laboratory measurement of hemoglobin), with the patient breathing oxygen via a face-mask (FiO2 50 ± 5%), with the patient breathing oxygen via a face-mask (FiO2 90 ± 5%) (simultaneous blood sample for a laboratory measurement of hemoglobin).

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- adult patients scheduled for a potentially hemorrhagic surgical procedure
Exclusion Criteria:
- anomaly (malformation, infection, swelling, irritation, ulceration, degenerative changes or significant edema) of the fingers,
- tremors.
